If two firefox icons are available in the taskbar (example: 3.6 and 4.0) and two or more instances of the browser are available on of the icons remains active for a short period of time

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch firefox (example: version 4.0) 
2. Launch firefox (example: version 3.6)
Actual Results:  
1. The firefox icon (example: v.4.0) in the taskbar is active 
2. The firefox icon (example: v.3.6) in the taskbar is active and in the same time the firefox 4.0 icon is visible as if 2 windows are open

Expected Results:  
2. Only the firefox 4.0 icon should be active

========
Prerequisites:
- at least 2 different firefox versions installed
- at least 2 icons of different firefox versions present in the taskbar

comments.raw_text: This is on Windows 7. The issue refers to the fact that when running 2 or more instances of 2 versions of firefox (one of which RC) (example: 3.6 or other v of firefox and 4.0RC), in the taskbar, at one moment, there will be 3 active instances visible.
